medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, arthralgias, dyspnea, and pulmonary infiltrates.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 14 months before admission, when swelling of the left lower eyelid developed. Symptoms progressed over time to include swelling and erythema of both lower eyelids, painful swelling between the metacarpals, pleuritic chest pain, dyspnea, persistent fatigue, myalgias, joint pains, and intermittent fevers. Symptoms did not improve with ibuprofen. Notable worsening occurred, leading to hospitalization.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of acne and allergic rhinitis; allergy to penicillin (manifested by a rash).
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had rheumatoid arthritis; aunt died at 58 years of age from systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
medical_history.social_history: Student living in a dormitory; does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs; not sexually active.
